svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
June 25, 2022" date: "2022-06-25"
• Mainnet-shadow-fork-7 merged with caveats: known Besu concurrency issue and Erigon issue with shadow forks
• Update your nodes for Gray Glacier upgrade
• Latest core devs call video . Notes from Tim Beiko and Christine Kim : Sepolia testnet merge planned for July 6 Mainnet shadow fork 8
planned for first week in July Calls moving to Thursdays after next call
• Sepolia testnet merge planned for July 6
• Mainnet shadow fork 8 planned for first week in July
• Calls moving to Thursdays after next call
• Geth making progress on historical state pruning
• KZG ceremony call video : plan to start ceremony in November (3 month general participation + 1 month special participation), use output
• NiceNode (interface to run a client) adds multi-client support
• Vitalik: possible roadmap for account abstraction using ERC4337 and adding features to protocol to make account abstraction the default
• EF seeks proposals to create technical documentation for staking operators
• Nimbus v22.6.0 : Ropsten & Sepolia testnet support, UX improvements & fixes
• Prysm v2.1.3-rc.4 : Sepolia testnet support and Panda Merge banner
• Lido expands node operators , includes four client teams
• EIP5169 : Client script URI for token contracts
• EIP5170 : Asserting authenticity of client script for token contracts
This newsletter is made possible thanks to SpeedRunEthereum !
Are you a web2 dev who wants to get into web3?
The best way to go from zero to hero is SpeedRunEthereum.com .
Learn how to build on Ethereum; the superpowers and the gotchas.
Then speed run Ethereum by testing your skills in a series of challenges and join web3 .
• Testnet shutdown timeline : Kiln after mainnet Merge, Ropsten Q4, Rinkeby Q2-Q3 2023
• EthereumJS VM v5.9.3 Gray Glacier support
• Foundry x Huff : compile & test Huff contracts using Foundry
• NFT gas optimization by encoding metadata into the token ID
• DeFi Hacks : reproduce DeFi incidents using Foundry
• Damn Vulnerable DeFi (CTF) Foundry version implements all levels
• Nethereum v4.6.1 (.Net library): MetaMask nuget package, Proof of Humanity integration
• Horizon bridge between Ethereum & Harmony $100 million exploit , 2 of 5 multisig had addresses compromised
• Namecheap DNS attack for DeFi Saver , Convex Finance and Ribbon Finance ; check your token approvals
• EF Fellowship Program cohort #2 applications open
• Wallet devs call video and notes : discussions on EIP5139 RPC provider lists, interoperability testing and multi wallet support in a
• Etherscan watch list adds ERC721 & ERC1155 token transfer support
• Shopify token gated merch via Shop app and in-store POS
• Uniswap Labs acquired Genie (NFT market aggregator) to expand into NFTs
• LooksRare conditional listing : list two items and automatically cancel the listing when one item sells
• Bancor paused Impermanent Loss Protection due to market conditions
• Timeless (yield market protocol) live on mainnet
• Arbitrum Odyssey : 8 week promotion to encourage bridging and usage of selected projects using NFT rewards
• GridPlus hiring a Go/protocol dev for the private, scalable PhononDAO
• Status is looking for a Senior Rust Engineer for Waku
• Taiko ZKRollup: hiring senior golang & rust backend developers .
• EF: generalist developer to drive strategic ecosystem initiatives
Job listings: $600 for four issues (~75 character limit), payable in ETH/DAI/USDC to abcoathup.eth on mainnet/Arbitrum/Optimism. Pay with
one click using 3cities. Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
• UK Treasury [PDF] removes proposed KYC requirement for self hosted wallet transfers
• Erik Voorhees: benefits of being a DAO for ShapeShift
• Tether launching GBPT (British Pound sterling stablecoin)
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @evan_van_ness and @abcoathup to get most of the week’s news in
• Jun 30 – Devcon discounted ticket applications close
• Jul 1 – Data Availability Sampling proposals due
• Jul 8 – Staking operator documentation proposals due
• Jul 17 – EF Fellowship program applications close
Sign up to receive this newsletter weekly
